sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Devotional and Liturgical Texts
[Untitled]
msDesc.p: Paper, 214 134 , 8.5 x 5.8, ff. 188, mostly 33 lines to a page. Cent. xiv-xv, well written. Discoloured and tender from damp.
Binding, one tag left and some bosses.
In the cover are some notes (f. iiiv). The first three leaves (ff. 1r-4v) are fragmentary. They contain prayers.

msItem.ab: Oracio ad impetrand. xxxvi gradus caritatis ven. dne dorothee reuelatos
msItem.incipit: Domine deus qui precipis
msItem.rubric: Sequitur oracio Sancti Augustini ardentis desiderii
msItem.incipit: O criste benedicte domine verbum
Deus piissime deus clemens
Illius assit gratia qui stricta cinctus fascia
msItem.ab: Printed by Milchsack Hymni et Sequentiae, Halle 1886 I, p. 143
It is an acrostic by Franco of Meschede (a fact not noted by Milchsack): the initials of the stanzas (after the first) form the following sentence

ab.q: Franco Scolaster Meschedensis servitor alme virginis Marie humilis et deuotus ista collegit et domino Iohanni pape xxii misit

msItem.ab: In this copy this sentence is written at the top of f. 13r with the addition
ut patet infra in literis capitalibus per ordinem intuentibus
After the acrostic follow a number of stanzas beginning with Tu, and the poem ends as in Milchsack
msItem.explicit: Concedat nobis penitus et nunc et semper amen
msItem.ab: There are a few marginal notes
msItem.rubric: Incipit psalterium b. virginis conforme in numero ordine et sensu psalmis ciauiticis. In quo aliquando ponitur numerus singularis aliquando pluralis prout exigit psalmus originalis

lg.l: Ave virgo lignum vite. ad aquarum vires rite ... us fructiferum
Per quod dampnum soluit ligni. deus karitatis igni. notati pestiferum

msItem.incipit: Ave morum disciplina, etc.
msItem.explicit: laudo salus te amantis. deum collaudans in sanctis. cum quocunque flamine
msItem.ab: Acrostic (preceded by one line) on the name VVicboldi

lg.l: Cantica virgo pia tibi sint mea grata maria.
Virgula que florern vite fers atque pudorem,
etc.

msItem.rubric: Incipiunt septem gaudia Marie Virginis Wicboldi

lg.l: Versibus alma parens parens tibi reddere vota.
Vota prius conor, etc.
Gaude quod domino dominorum mansio cara.
Cara que sis flores, etc.

msItem.ab: The last two syllables of each line are repeated at the beginning of the next; a quatrain is devoted to each gaudium

lg.l: terrenos attrahe post te
Hos, tenebras deme. de metro fiat id e me

msItem.incipit: Virgo dei vixit sexagenta tribus annis
Si timor est sine spe tunc desperacio ledit

lg.l: Desere nunc anima lectulum soporis
Langwor stupor vanitas excludatur foris
Intusque cor ferueat facibus amoris
Recolens mirifica facta saluatoris
Ex hoc virgo poteris secura gaudere
Tibi nequit amodo dolor preualere
Sed nec ultra filio ualet mors nocere
Pia nobis igitur mater miserere. Amen

msItem.incipit: Respice qui transis quia tu michi causa doloris

lg.l: L. x. bis duo C superaddita milia quinque
Tot fertur Christus pro nobis vulnera passus
Salue mundi salutare. Salue salue Ihesu kare. tue cruci me aptare.
Velle vere tu scis quare. da michi tui copiam.
Ac si presens sis accedo ymmo te presentem credo.
O quam nudum te hic cerno ecce tibi me prosterno. Sis facilis ad veniam

msItem.explicit: O Amator amplectende temet ipsum tunc ostende in cruce salutifera. Amen
msItem.ab: Deus qui uniuersum mundum quinque wlneribus, etc.
msItem.rubric: Hic est planctus beati Bernhardi quem cottidie planxit super passionem Christi, etc.

lg.l: Aue capud inclinatum. despectiue coronatum. spinis infidelium.
Aue manus dextra christi, perforata plaga tristi

msItem.incipit: Ave quem desidero quem auide requiro
msItem.ab: Note of indulgence, attributing the above to St Bernard
msItem.incipit: Ave viua caro Christi. que in panem te misisti
Recolamus sacram cenam tam suauem quam amenam
Ave viuens hostia veritas et vita

lg.l: Culter qui circumcidisti sacrosanctam carnem Christi
Cuncta christi armatura nos hic sanet ut futura perfruamur gloria. Amen

msItem.ab: Note of indulgence granted by Innocent IV at the Council of Lyons
msItem.incipit: Sanctus (ter) dominus deus sabaoth sancta trinitas
msItem.ab: A series of prayers continuing to f. 54r without fresh heading
msItem.rubric: Oracio hec pronuncciata Prage per doctorem sacre pagine Johannem ysnen (or ysneri) et debet dici infra eleuacionem misse
msItem.incipit: Fac quesumus domine Ihesu Christe ... misterium tuum
Suscipe confessionem meam unica spes
Mediator dei et hominum
Si pietatem t(uam) mitissime deus
Dum crucem dulcissimi filii
Intueamur deformatum valde
Alpha et O magne deus (Hildebert)
msItem.explicit: Mereamur vere vite coniungi in celestibus
msItem.incipit: De profundis mentis undis quibus mersus pereo
Ihesu dulcis et decore Rosa fraglans miro more
Transfigit dulcissime Ihesu medullas anime mee
msItem.ab: Three more prayers to the Son
msItem.incipit: Consciencia quidem trepidus et cor pollutus
msItem.rubric: Gratias siue conclusio que dicitur post missam. S. Bernhardi
msItem.incipit: Eya nunc oro optime deus
Ihesu Christe summe deus. sancte pater et rex meus
msItem.explicit: per te semper et habere sempiterna gaudia. Amen
msItem.incipit: Accepimus singulare misterium
msItem.ab: followed by some 17 prayers to Christ, mostly intended to be said at or after Mass
msItem.incipit: Kyrieleyson ... Sancta dei genitrix
Precor te beatissima
Ihesu dulcis memoria
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt Hore canonice Conpassionis beate Marie Virginis
msItem.incipit: Stabat mater dolorosa
msItem.rubric: Hanc oracionem prenotatam edidit Bonifacius papa de planctu beate Virginis Marie quam confirmauit Indulgencia .7. annorum et quatuor barenarum
De quinque doloribus compassionis beate Virginis Marie
msItem.incipit: Ave virga florens yesse. tibi parem nusquam esse
msItem.explicit: confer locum et tutamen in celesti aula amen
msItem.incipit: Recordare mater christi quia hic quem dilexisti ex te pauper nascitur
O Soboles ecclesie sponsa solis iusticie
Domina labia mea resera
Te matrem dei laudamus
msItem.rubric: Hec oracio (title cut off) ... ad membra corporis eiusdem
msItem.incipit: Ave mea specialis pulchra suauis curialis
msItem.rubric: Incipit septem gaudia beate Marie Virginis
msItem.incipit: Gaude plaude clara rosa esto mesto cara prosa
msItem.explicit: tu excusa quod offendo. diebus atque noctibus. amen

lg.l: Hec laus prescripta tibi gloria sit benedicta.
Ut valeam tecum regnare perhenniter amen

msItem.incipit: Gaude virgo stella maris sponsa christo singularis
msItem.rubric: Ad beatam Virginem Mariam Inicium laudis
msItem.incipit: Gaude summi creatoris sponsa gloriosa
msItem.ab: Followed by other addresses in verse to the Virgin
msItem.rubric: Gaudia bis dena matri dulcedine plena (3 lines)
msItem.incipit: Gaude virgo mater christi que per aurem concepisti
Iam translata polis eterna cellula solis (3 lines)
Gaude clara stella maris que sub nato principaris
O mater christi que semper virgo fuisti, etc.
Ad te virgo pia clemens suspiro maria
Ave uirgo electissima mater almi redemptoris
msItem.rubric: Incipit oracio deuota Sancti augustini doctoris et episcopi ad beatum Virginem Mariam

lg.l: Salue mater misericordie mater spei et mater venie.
Mater dei et mater gracie mater inquam tocius glorie, etc.

msItem.ab: Four lines added in lower margin
msItem.incipit: O mater glustri dulcor candorque ligustri
msItem.explicit: que placare deum non desinis est finis huius dictaminis amen

lg.l: Jesse proles pelle moles que me premunt scelerum
per eterna nos guberna deus ante secula. Amen

msItem.incipit: Tu es porta paradisi
Maria virgo uirginum que genuisti dominum
Maria mater gracie conforta nos in acie contra seductores
O maria mater pia cunctorum fidelium
Ait doctor gloriosus nullus fiat dubiosus
msItem.ab: After this paragraph (for the whole is written as prose) each paragraph begins with a word of the Ave Maria ending fructus uentris tui. Amen
msItem.incipit: Ave digne te saluto absque ve te totam puto
msItem.ab: Followed by others of similar construction
msItem.incipit: Ave desiderii flos et fons decoris
Ave dei genitrix et inmaculata
Ave lucis speculum virgo generosa
Tu quondam per angelum sumens magnum Ave
Ave virgo virginum spes desperatorum
msItem.ab: Expansion of the Salue Regina in prose
msItem.incipit: Ad salutandam b. V. M. primo debes eius magnitudinem considerare
msItem.ab: Two more acrostics on the Ave
msItem.incipit: Ave virgo singularis nostra salus que probaris
Ave mater Ihesu Christi que intacta permansisti
Salue pastor gregis Christi quem pascendo docuisti
Ave petre beatorum dux sanctorum apostolorum
Salue lumen gloriosum omnium ecclesiarum
Salue pater inclite decus puritatis
Ave gemma claritatis
Ave candens lylium per marie filium vernans katherina
msItem.rubric: Hanc or. composuit urbanus papa (the rest of the note faint)
msItem.incipit: Ave virgo gloriosa ave rosa speciosa margarita nobilis
Nobilis et iusta virgo mitis dorothea
msItem.rubric: Sequens oratio continet .X. tormenta passionis beate virginis dorothee
msItem.incipit: Salue sancta dorothea audi queso vota mea
msItem.ab: A series of devotions to St Barbara
msItem.incipit: Ave virgo barbara speculum honoris
Ave salue gaude vale O beata barbara
Ad celestem regiam virgo migratura
Ave barbara preclara
O celicola beata
Gaude martir margaretha
O vernantes christi rose supra modum speciose
Anna pia mater aue
Gaude anna mater matris
Ave mater virginis
Ave marie cella
Ave plena magdalena
Gaude pia magdalena
O maria magdalena fulgens in arce serena
msItem.rubric: Hanc or. fecit fr. Wilhelmus doctor sacre theologie domini pape penitenciarius
msItem.incipit: Felix que celi solio regnas cum dei filio
Martha Ihesu hospita ei predilecta
Ex stirpe que regia elyzabeth es exorta
msItem.rubric: Sequens or. valet pro omni necessitate, etc.
msItem.incipit: Regina clemencie maria vocata
Summe sacerdos et vere pontifex

lg.l: Diues ait si nobilitas mea magna quid inde, etc.
Vado mori mors certa quidem nil certius illa
Quanta subincerta sit mora vado mori
Ex hiis ergo potest quiuis concludere sensum
Pronus ad mortem post omitia facta recursus

msItem.ab: Dialogue of Jesus and the Virgin in rhyme

lg.l: Sepe cum dulcissimo Ihesu (?) residebat
Maria solitaria et cum ipso que tenebat
Dulce solilo(quium) diuersaque querebat
Que cuncta prudentissime Ihesus exponebat
Nam in tuo transitu sum ad te reuersurus
Atque te suscipiam in celum positurus

msItem.rubric: Explicit dialogus Sancte virginis marie siue soliloquium Ihesu cum maria matre sua. Germanus
msItem.ab: This is from the Vita Rhythmica B. V. M. et Salvatoris (edited by A. Vögtlin, Bibl. des litt. Vereins in Stuttgart, no. 180, 1888) ll. 3450 sqq.
msItem.incipit: Peto clemenciam tuam deus ut descendat super panem
Benignissime ac misericordissime
Ante oculos tue maiestatis
O fons misericordie (six)
O dulcis domine
O omnipotentissime
Anima mea erumpnosa
Domina mea sancte maria perpetua virgo
msItem.rubric: Has oraciones infrascriptas nouem diebus ante quodlibet festum beate Virginis Marie etc.
msItem.incipit: Salue rosa que non habes spinam nec peccati labes
msItem.ab: Prayers for nine days are given
Directions for a server at Mass (19 lines)
msItem.incipit: Seruus (?) ad altare seruire volens memorare
msItem.ab: Seven things to be kept in mind
msItem.incipit: Salue nobilis virga yesse
Pura virgo noster chorus O maria sit sonorus
Flos de spina procreatus
Inclite confessor pressor nicolae doloris
Petre princeps fidei et apostolorum. cui claues tradite regni sunt celorum

lg.l: Laude breui pandam uel paucis uersibus edam.
Hystoriam triplicem multa cinxi breuitate.
Sit tibi laus christe sit gloria lausque Marie
Denariis triginta deum vendit galileus
Quos et apostolus hic describit bartholomeus
Vnde prius veniant quis fabricauit eos

msItem.ab: Apparently from Godfrey of Viterbo's Pantheon, ending
The xv Oos of St Bridget with a Preface
msItem.incipit: Quicunque hanc infrascriptam oracionem per circulum unius anni deuote frequentauerit
msItem.rubric: Oracio pro affliccionis releuacione Sancti Augustini episcopi
msItem.incipit: Dulcissime Ihesu Christe verus deus qui de sinu patris
Summe sacerdos secundum ordinem melchisedech
Astra matutina laudate dominum
Sancta et immaculata creatura
msItem.rubric: Anno domini 1285. contexta est subsequens oracio de interuallo et aureo numero ciclo solari litera dominicali et bissexto inueniendis
msItem.incipit: Aue [g] preclara [f] celorum [e] regina [d c] aduocata [b]

lg.l: Cristum iudea dea perfidie crucifigis
figis transpalmas almas plantasque latusque
usque necis, etc.

msItem.ab: A complete copy of the prayer Salue preclara celorum (f. 159r)
msItem.incipit: Domine Ihesu Christe redempcio mea
msItem.ab: Those already given are omitted. Ends
msItem.incipit: Digna benigna dei genitrix te meritis
msItem.ab: On f. 188r (once stuck to the cover) are verses de ecclesia (4)
msItem.incipit: Hic locus orandi contemplandi meditandi
msItem.ab: Note on the additions to the Mass made by Euaristus, etc. And some other verses.
